Course.title: Course
Course.description: Represents a course offered by Spruce Life Skills.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Course entity.

description.description: A detailed description of the course.

category.description: The category that the course belongs to (e.g., NEP).

imageUrl.description: URL of the image representing the course.

Inquiry.title: Inquiry
Inquiry.description: Represents an inquiry or enrollment request from a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Inquiry entity.

name.description: Name of the person making the inquiry.

email.description: Email address of the person making the inquiry.

phoneNumber.description: Phone number of the person making the inquiry.

message.description: Additional message or details provided by the user.

date.description: Date and time when the inquiry was submitted.

definition.description: Stores user inquiries related to the courses.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore data structure is designed to support the SpruceConnect application, focusing on courses and user inquiries. It prioritizes simplicity, security, and scalability. Since all data is public, no special access control is necessary.

*   **Courses Collection:** Stores information about each course. This allows easy retrieval and display of course details in the app's course catalog.
*   **Inquiries Collection:** Stores user inquiries related to the courses. This helps to manage and respond to user requests efficiently.

Authorization Independence (N/A): Since there are no write permissions necessary, authorization independence is irrelevant. The course and inquiry data is considered open access.

QAPs Support (List operations): The structure supports listing all courses and inquiries without complex filtering. This is because all documents in each collection share the same security posture.
